awd_titl_txt: Conference: Design and Analysis of Experiments 2024
awd_abstract_narration:
The Design and Analysis of Experiments Conference 2024 (DAE 2024) will meet May 15-17, 2024 on the campus of Virginia Tech in Blacksburg, VA. It will bring together researchers from across the United States and beyond, and from both academia and industry, to focus on advancing the statistical techniques for experimentation that empower knowledge discovery. It will provide a forum for interaction, discussion, and exchange of ideas on novel research for designing effective experiments, and for analyzing the data that they produce. The aim of the conference is to increase the efficacy of data collection in areas as wide-ranging as autonomous driving, drug development, environmental monitoring, infectious disease dynamics, cybersecurity, and manufacturing, among many others, and so accelerate the pace of innovation in all of these domains. DAE 2024 will emphasize inclusion and mentoring of young researchers and minorities, and in so doing will be a cog in the development of the next generation of statistical experts in the techniques of experimental design.

Designed experimentation and the corresponding techniques for analysis are integral to the process of scientific discovery, be it in engineering, medicine, commerce, manufacturing, or indeed in any of the vast range of human activities where continuing knowledge acquisition is a requirement for advancement and success. Driven by these needs, developments are rapidly taking place in experimental design and analysis research, in both traditional and emerging areas of applications. As new areas of application arise, correspondingly new computational tools are enabling the development of better designs for data collection in complex problems. Technical sessions of DAE 2024 will include leading experts addressing Covering Arrays and Combinatorial Testing; Online Experimentation; Sequential Design, Active Learning, and Bayesian Optimization; Design Issues in Uncertainty Quantification; Orthogonal Arrays and Related Designs; Causal Inference and Experimental Design; Design Challenges in Transportation; and more. Additional features will include roundtable discussions, mentoring sessions for junior researchers, and poster sessions highlighting advancements in addition to those covered in the technical sessions.  Further details about the conference may be found at https://sites.google.com/view/dae2024/dae-2024.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.inst_name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

por.por_cntn:
The Design and Analysis of Experiments Conference 2024 (DAE 2024), held May 15 to May 17 at Virginia Tech, brought together new and experienced researchers, from across academia and industry, to present and examine many challenging problems in designing effective experiments for knowledge acquisition across a range of fields. Topics of focus in the ten two-hour technical sessions, organized by top names in the field, included problems in online experimentation, in computer experimentation, experimentation in transportation studies, experimental procedures for establishing causation, experiments with large numbers of factors, procedures for identifying important factors, sequential conduct of experiments, and much more.  Developing young scientists is important in every field, a role supported by DAE 2024 through emphasis on interaction between senior researchers and those more junior, including students. Over 40% of attendees were students, and there were nine mentoring sessions pairing students with seniors. Two poster sessions featured 34 presentations from students generated extensive discussions and feedback. Conference registration fees were waived for student poster presenters, and travel support was provided for students in need. Junior (student or within six years of PhD) researchers comprised 45% of the speakers in the ten technical sessions. A panel discussion on present and future challenges featured six senior panelists with active discussion from a wide swath of the 100 participants.

More information on DAE 2024, including the detailed program book and abstracts for all of the technical talks and posters, can be obtained from the conference website at this link: DAE 2024

 


Last Modified: 04/09/2025
Modified by: John P Morgan
